comment: Dr. Johnson's an incredible teacher. She was in the field for a while, and went back to school to get her doctorate to teach. & She is phenomenal. I wish I was on the case management track so I could take more classes from her. She cares about her students. I had her for a three hour, block class. She used all of the time, but I was never bored.

She's a nice teacher but her exams are really hard. The in class interview you have to do I tedious and will make you go crazy. She's a really tough grader and no matter how hard you try you won't get your A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: I've taken Dr. Johnson for 3 classes now, two online and one in-class. She is an awesome professor, and class is interesting and fairly easy. For HS2400, there is one easy paper, two tests, and some smaller grades. Her tests are from her powerpoints, so its not necessary to read the book but it does help. Love her and I'm taking her again next year

I'm taking her for research methods, and although it may seem like a lot of work. It's not. I met with her, and she gave me a better understanding on somethings. She is pretty friendly. Just make sure you stay on top of due dates and do not procrastinate with assignments. Read over the syllabus, and you will be fine!
Though grader on papers. Directions on some assignments are a bit unclear.

I loved Dr. Johnson's interviewing skills class. She made the assignments pretty easy and the only two tests were online. I'm taking her Research Methods class next semester which I heard is harder but her Interviewing skills class was a breeze.

This class is by far the worst class that I have taken thus far at KSU. It is a complete waste of time and I learned absolutely nothing. The instruction was horrible and the content was horrible. Tests were given with 10 parts to one question and only an hour to complete. This class needs to be taught face to face by someone other than Johnson.

Dr. J is an amazing teacher!! She made interviewing skills fun and easy- take notes and do the assignments and you'll do great! As far as the bad reviews- ignore them. You have to really try and be lazy to get a bad grade!

There was absolutely no clarity on assignments. It was near impossible to get feedback, and responses to emails were scarce. The typical response was "needs revised" but would not include how to revise, or what was expected.

Great teacher! I took her online research methods and her HS overview class and made As in both (without buying either text!)Do show up for class though because her test come straight from her notes. She's a great teacher and has a passion for what she teaches. I highly recommend her!
Took her for interviewing skills. The class itself is not fun, really boring material. She is a super nice lady but I felt she graded harshly and it was a pretty hard workload.

Dr. J is so knowledgable and makes this course fun! Class consisted of lectures, guest speakers, role plays, and a few projects to test interviewing skills, and one midterm and one final. I loved this class, and she is very clear about what she expects.

Took this course online, and am ending the semester with total regret.  You have to do a group project (which includes a powerpoint and an essay) and meet for lab on campus - both of which are entirely ridiculous concerning the fact that students taking online courses are usually unable to come to campus or meet up with other students!  NOT recc'd

I had Dr.J for May mester and loved her class. Great guest speakers, exciting material, clear expectations. you do have to study for her test however,she covers all material and has power points to help you study. This was one of my favorite classes to date and she is awesome!

This is a great class.  Dr. J is a good teacher she knows the material, but she is not very helpful.  I received an A in this class.  I found it to be a hard class because of the way she grades papers
She makes it clear through the Power Points what you should know for testing.  Read the book before class and you'll be fine.
